org.streaminer.stream.histogram.spdt

Class Histogram<T extends Target>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.histogram.spdt.Histogram<T>

  • public class Histogram<T extends Target>
extends Object
    Implements a Histogram as defined by the Streaming Parallel Decision Tree (SPDT) algorithm.

    The Histogram consumes numeric points and maintains a running approximation of the dataset using the given number of bins. The methods insert, sum, and uniform are described in detail in the SPDT paper.

    The histogram has an insert method which uses two parameters and an extendedSum method which add the capabilities described in Tyree's paper. Along with Tyree's extension this histogram supports inserts with categorical targets.

    Author:
    Adam Ashenfelter (ashenfelter@bigml.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Histogram

        public Histogram(int maxBins,
         boolean countWeightedGaps,
         Collection<Object> categories,
         Collection<Histogram.TargetType> groupTypes,
         Long freezeThreshold,
         Histogram.BinReservoirType reservoirType)
        Creates an empty Histogram with the defined number of bins.
        Parameters:
        maxBins - the maximum number of bins for this histogram
        countWeightedGaps - true if count weighted gaps are desired
        categories - if the histogram uses categorical targets then a collection of the possible category targets may be provided to increase performance
        groups - if the histogram uses a group target then a collection group target types may be provided
        freezeThreshold - after this # of inserts, bin locations will 'freeze', increasing the performance of future inserts
        reservoirType - selects the bin reservoir implementation, defaults to 'array' when # bins < 256 and 'tree' otherwise

      • Histogram

        public Histogram(int maxBins,
         boolean countWeightedGaps)
        Creates an empty Histogram with the defined number of bins.
        Parameters:
        maxBins - the maximum number of bins for this histogram
        countWeightedGaps - true if count weighted gaps are desired

                  Collection<Object> group)

        Parameters:
        point - the new point
        target - the group targets
